verses.roman:
śasya samarpaṇa kari' bāhire dheyāna
śasya khāñā kṛṣṇa kare śūnya bhājana

synonyms: śasya—the pulp; samarpaṇa kari'-offering; bāhire—outside the temple room; dheyāna—meditates; śasya khāñā—eating the pulp; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; kare—makes; śūnya—vacant; bhājana—the plate.
translation: "After offering the pulp, he would meditate outside the temple door. In the meantime, Lord Kṛṣṇa, having eaten the pulp, would leave the plate empty.
